intro: Pillansia, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet bell-shaped flowers. The plant has a bulbous root system that stores water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Pillansia blooms during the summer months, often in late winter to early spring. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
